required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Midwife-led Continuity and Satisfaction With Care - an Observational Case-Control Study in Palestine
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Midwifery Model in Palestine

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigate if a midwife-led continuity model of care in Palestine, had impact on rural women's satisfaction with care through the continuum of antenatal, intrapartum and postnatal period.

detailed_description.textblock:
Between 2013 and 2016 a midwife-led continuity model of care was implemented in parts of the Palestinian governmental health system, to improve maternal services to women in rural areas on the occupied West Bank. This study investigated if and how the model influenced women`s satisfaction with care, through the continuum of the antenatal-, intrapartum- and postnatal period.
Using an observational case-control design to compare the midwife-led continuity model of care with regular maternity care. Women with singleton pregnancies, who had registered for antenatal care at a rural governmental clinic, were during the first six months after birth invited to answer a questionnaire containing 60 questions with a 7-points Likert scale, rating different aspects of satisfaction with care.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean sum-score satisfaction with care during the continuum of pregnancy,intrapartum and postnatal period
primary_outcome.time_frame: One to six months after birth
primary_outcome.description: Summarising mean score in all questions measuring satisfaction and dividing on number of questions included

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean sum-score satisfaction with care during pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One to six months after birth
secondary_outcome.description: Summarising the mean score of the questions measuring satisfaction with care during pregnancy and dividing on number of questions included

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean sum-score satisfaction with care during Labour and birth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One to six months after birth
secondary_outcome.description: Summarising mean score of questions measuring satisfaction with care during Labour and birth, dividing on number of questions included

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean sum-score satisfaction with care during postnatal period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One to six month after birth
secondary_outcome.description: Summarising mean scores of questions measuring satisfaction with care during postnatal period, and dividing on number of questions included

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One to six month after birth
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of women who were still exclusive breastfeeding at the timepoint of interview, adjusted with number of weeks since birth

arm_group.description: Women receiving midwife-led model of care though the continuum of pregnancy, birth and postnatal period, and who registered at the governmental clinic in a rural village.
Women receiving regular maternal care through the continuum of pregnancy, birth and postnatal period, and who registered at the governmental clinic in a rural village.

intervention.description: Midwives from governmental hospitals provide antenatal and postnatal case-load-care in rural villages governmental clinics

study_pop.textblock: Rural women in the West Bank, occupied Palestine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Residing in rural village
- Registered for pregnancy care at the villages governmental clinic
- With singleton pregnancy
- Gave birth the last one to six month
Exclusion Criteria:
- Residing in urban areas
- With multiple pregnancy
- Not registered for antenatal care at the local governmental clinic

patient_data.ipd_description: The anonymous IPD might be provided upon request
